Pre-existing Radioresistant Subclones Determine Radioresistance in Rectal Cancer Organoids 1 In vitro radiation response and clinical data 1.1 Progression-free survival 1.2 In vitro dose-response

Pre-existing Radioresistant Subclones Determine Radioresistance in Rectal Cancer Organoids Daan Andel 2023-07-18 1 In vitro radiation response and clinical data 1.1 Progression-free survival # Libraries and sources library(readxl) library(tidyverse) library(ggplot2) library(ggfortify) library(survival) library(survminer) library(survMisc) library(cowplot) ######## # Data # ######## # Loading survival data from time of surgery surg_surv <- as.data.frame(read_excel("../cna_analysis/data/clinical_and_dr/data_survival_progression.xlsx", sheet = "surg_surv")) # Loading progression data from time of surgery surg_prog <- as.data.frame(read_excel("../cna_analysis/data/clinical_and_dr/data_survival_progression.xlsx", sheet = "surg_prog")) ####### # Run # ####### ## Survival from time of surgery ## surg_surv_sum <- Surv(time = surg_surv$time, event = surg_surv$status == 2) # Fit without strata (~1) surg_surv_fit <- survfit(surg_surv_sum ~ 1) # Median survival from time of surgery surv_median(surg_surv_fit)[1,2] ## [1] 1857 ## Progression from time of surgery ## surg_prog_sum <- Surv(time = surg_prog$time, event = surg_prog$status == 2) # Fit without strata (~1) surg_prog_fit <- survfit(surg_prog_sum ~ 1) # Median progression from time of surgery surv_median(surg_prog_fit)[1,2] ## [1] NA ######## # Plot # ######## # Constructing a dataframe for annotating labels anno_df_prog <- data.frame(label = surg_prog$organoid, time = surg_prog$time) # make temp df with survival/prob data temp_df_prob_prog <- data.frame(time = surg_prog_fit$time, prob = surg_prog_fit$surv ) # join together anno_df_prog <- left_join(anno_df_prog, temp_df_prob_prog) # sort by time anno_df_prog <- anno_df_prog[order(anno_df_prog$time),] # Plotting progression free survival prog_p <- ggsurvplot(surg_prog_fit, data = surg_prog, conf.int = F, palette = c("#00887d"), ggtheme = theme_cowplot(), legend = 'none', censor.size = 8, xlim = c(0,2200), ylab = 'Progression-free survival probability', xlab = 'Time from surgery (days)') # adding labels prog_p$plot <- prog_p$plot + annotate("text", x = anno_df_prog$time + c(350, 350, 350, -150,50,250,0,0), y = anno_df_prog$prob + c(0.1,0.1,0.1, -0.05, 0.05, -0.05, 0.05,-0.05), label = anno_df_prog$label) + theme(aspect.ratio = 5/3) + coord_cartesian(clip = 'off') prog_p 1.2 In vitro dose-response 1.2.1 Representative plot # Libraries and sources library(tidyverse) # for wrangling data library(readxl) # for reading excel files library(DescTools) # for computing AUCs with AUC() function) library(drc) # for fitting dose response library(cowplot) library(wesanderson) source('R/auc_rad.R') source('R/fitter_rad.R') source('R/ic50_rad.R') source('R/relativize_dr.R') ################ # Loading data # ################ d <- data.frame(read_excel('../cna_analysis/data/clinical_and_dr/resistancy_organoids.xlsx')) # remove fluke experiment (can't be fitted by the drc package in metricsandfits.R) d <- subset(d, expcode != 'cva0028') # remove dose 1, 10,12 d <- subset(d, dose %in% c(0,2,4,6,8)) # only include organoids that were not radiated d <- subset(d, rec_rad == 0) ############## # Relativize # ############## # Relativizing the data # split per experiment per_exp <- split(d, f = d$expcode, drop = TRUE) # apply relative function to every instance in per_exp rel_vector_unrad <- lapply(per_exp, relative, rad = F) # join the dataframes togheter d_nonrad = do.call(rbind, rel_vector_unrad) #remove rownames rownames(d_nonrad) <- NULL # pool d_rad and d_nonrad, if not possible, make d d_nonrad # try to bind d_rad and d_nonrad. If d_rad is empty (this is the case when # rec_rad does not have ones, make d the same as d_nonrad) d <- d_nonrad ################ # Loading data # ################ load("../cna_analysis/rda/clinical_and_dr/wrangled-data.rda") # load the wrangled data, data is saved under 'd' # defining experiment number for reference exp_numb <- unique(d$expcode) exp_numb <- paste(unlist(exp_numb), collapse='') ################## ### Metric AUC ### ################## # split per experiment per_exp <- split(d, f = d$expcode, drop = TRUE) # apply relative function to every instance in per_exp AUC_vector <- lapply(per_exp, AUC_fun) # join the dataframes togheter AUC = do.call(rbind, AUC_vector) # remove rownames rownames(AUC) <- NULL ####### # Fit # ####### # apply fit function to every instance in per_exp fit_vector <- lapply(per_exp, fitter) # join the dataframes toghether fit = do.call(rbind, fit_vector) # remove rownames rownames(fit) <- NULL fit$rec_rad = 0 # remove rownames rownames(fit) <- NULL ################## # relative IC50s # ################## ## relative under curve for unrad # apply relative function to every instance in per_exp IC50_vector <- lapply(per_exp, IC50_fun, rad = 0) # join the dataframes togheter IC50= do.call(rbind, IC50_vector) metrics = cbind(AUC, IC50) metrics$rec_rad <- 0 # compute mean of rel_AUC metrics_pooled <- metrics %>% group_by(cline) %>% summarise_at(vars(rel_AUC), funs(mean(., na.rm=TRUE))) metrics_pooled$expcode <- exp_numb # compute mean of rel_AUC metrics_pooled <- metrics %>% group_by(cline) %>% summarise_at(vars(rel_AUC), funs(mean(., na.rm=TRUE))) # summary statistics median(metrics$rel_AUC) ## [1] 0.5758785 min(metrics$rel_AUC) ## [1] 0.304031 max(metrics$rel_AUC) ## [1] 0.8152938 ######## # Data # ######## load("../cna_analysis/rda/clinical_and_dr/wrangled-data.rda") # load the wrangled data, data is saved under 'd' load("../cna_analysis/rda/clinical_and_dr/fitted-data.rda") # load the wrangled data, data is saved under 'fit' load('../cna_analysis/rda/clinical_and_dr/metrics_data.rda') # load the metrics data ########### # Wrangle # ########### ### define two dataframes, one from rad one without rad: fit <- subset(fit, rec_rad == 0) exp_numb <- unique(d$expcode) exp_numb <- paste(unlist(exp_numb), collapse='') # new data with doses. Note: lowest dose is not # log 0 but log('very small number') because otherwise this will hamper the scaling in ggplot later on. d$dose0 <- d$dose d$dose0[d$dose0 == 0] <- 0.00000001 # representative expcodes # makeing helper column to extract representative expcodes d$cline_expcode <- paste0(d$cline, '_', d$expcode) fit$cline_expcode <- paste0(fit$cline, '_', fit$expcode) # subsetting cline_expcode_pick <- c( 'HUB005_cva0025', 'HUB183_cva0025', 'HUB015_cva0023', 'HUB175_cva0024', 'HUB181I_cva0021', 'HUB197_cva0030', 'HUB106_cva0020', 'HUB062_cva0023', 'HUB112_cva0112') d <- subset(d, cline_expcode %in% cline_expcode_pick) fit <- subset(fit, cline_expcode %in% cline_expcode_pick) # add resistantcy group for colour coding resistant <- c('HUB005', 'HUB183', 'HUB015') sensitive <- c('HUB197', 'HUB106', 'HUB062') d$resistancy_group <- ifelse( d$cline %in% resistant, 'Resistant', ifelse(d$cline %in% sensitive, 'Sensitive', 'Intermediate') ) fit$resistancy_group <- ifelse( fit$cline %in% resistant, 'Resistant', ifelse(fit$cline %in% sensitive, 'Sensitive', 'Intermediate') ) # Make cline a factor and specify order by decreasing AUC mean d$cline <- factor(d$cline, levels = c('HUB005', 'HUB183', 'HUB015', 'HUB112', 'HUB175', 'HUB181I', 'HUB106', 'HUB197', 'HUB062')) d$resistancy_group <- factor(d$resistancy_group, levels = c('Resistant', 'Intermediate', 'Sensitive')) ggplot(NULL, aes(x = dose0, y = relative_mean, group = cline, col = resistancy_group)) + geom_point(data= d, size =3, aes(shape = cline)) + geom_errorbar(data = d, aes(ymin=relative_mean-relative_sem,ymax=relative_mean+relative_sem), width=0.1) + geom_line(data = d) + # geom_line(data=fit, aes(x=dose, y=pred), # size = 1) + # adding log x-axis coord_trans(#x="log10", xlim = c(0.00000001, 8), ylim = c(0, 1.1)) + scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(0, 2,4,6,8)) + scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) + theme_cowplot() + ylab('Normalized viability') + xlab('Dose (Gy)') + theme( legend.title = element_blank(), aspect.ratio = 5 / 3) + scale_shape_manual(values=seq(0,8)) + scale_colour_manual( values = c( Resistant = '#DE3163', Sensitive = '#5090CD', Intermediate = 'grey75' ), guide = guide_legend(override.aes = list( linetype = c(rep("blank", length( unique(d$resistancy_group) ))), shape = c(rep(19, length( unique(d$resistancy_group) ))) )) ) 1.2.2 rAUC across multiple experiments ######## # Data # ######## load('../cna_analysis/rda/clinical_and_dr/metrics_data.rda') # load the wrangled data, data is saved under 'metrics' exp_numb <- unique(metrics$expcode) exp_numb <- paste(unlist(exp_numb), collapse = '') ########### # Wrangle # ########### # Make cline a factor and specify order by decreasing AUC mean metrics$cline <- factor( metrics$cline, levels = metrics %>% group_by(cline) %>% summarize(mean_auc = mean(rel_AUC)) %>% arrange(-mean_auc) %>% pull(cline) ) # add resistantcy group for colour coding resistant <- c('HUB005', 'HUB183', 'HUB015') sensitive <- c('HUB197', 'HUB106', 'HUB062') metrics$resistancy_group <- ifelse( metrics$cline %in% resistant, 'Resistant', ifelse(metrics$cline %in% sensitive, 'Sensitive', 'Intermediate') ) # changing order of resistancy_group metrics$resistancy_group <- factor(metrics$resistancy_group, levels = c("Resistant", "Intermediate", "Sensitive")) ######## # Plot # ######## ggplot(metrics, aes(x = cline, y = rel_AUC, group = cline)) + geom_boxplot(aes(fill = resistancy_group)) + geom_jitter(height = 0, width = 0.1, size = 2) + theme_cowplot() + scale_fill_manual( values = c( Resistant = '#DE3163', Sensitive = '#5090CD', Intermediate = 'grey75' ), guide = guide_legend(override.aes = list( linetype = c(rep("blank", length( unique(metrics$resistancy_group) ))), shape = c(rep(19, length( unique(metrics$resistancy_group) ))) )) ) + xlab('') + ylab('Relative AUC') + theme( legend.title = element_blank(), aspect.ratio = 5 / 3, axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1) ) + coord_cartesian(clip = 'off') + scale_y_continuous(limits = c(0,1)) 1.2.3 Flow cytometry-based measurement of (apoptotic) cells with sub-G1 DNA content ########### # Wrangle # ########### d <- data.frame(read_excel("../cna_analysis/data/clinical_and_dr/nicoletti_data.xlsx")) # defining experiment number for referenc exp_numb <- unique(d$expcode) exp_numb <- paste(unlist(exp_numb), collapse = '') # defining apoptosis percentage d$apop_perc <- d$subg1 / d$singlets * 100 d_zero <- d %>% group_by(cline, expcode) %>% arrange(cline, expcode) %>% filter(dose == 0) d_five <- d %>% group_by(cline, expcode) %>% arrange(cline, expcode) %>% filter(dose == 5) df_fc_apop <- data.frame( cline = d_zero$cline, expcode = d_zero$expcode, fc_apop = d_five$apop_perc / d_zero$apop_perc ) %>% group_by(cline) %>% summarize(mean_apop_fc = mean(fc_apop), sd_apop_fc = sd(fc_apop)) df_fc_apop$cline <- factor(df_fc_apop$cline, levels = c('HUB005', 'HUB183', 'HUB062', 'HUB106')) df_fc_apop ## # A tibble: 4 Ã— 3 ## cline mean_apop_fc sd_apop_fc ## <fct> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 HUB005 1.31 0.538 ## 2 HUB062 5.88 0.903 ## 3 HUB106 11.8 0.714 ## 4 HUB183 2.93 0.0548 ######## # Plot # ######## ggplot(df_fc_apop, aes(x= cline, y = mean_apop_fc, fill = cline)) + geom_bar(aes(group = cline), stat = 'identity', position=position_dodge(), col = 'black') + geom_linerange(aes(ymin=mean_apop_fc, ymax=mean_apop_fc + sd_apop_fc), position=position_dodge(0.65), size = 1, alpha = 0.8) + theme_cowplot() + scale_fill_manual( values = c(HUB181I = "#8491B4FF", HUB005 = "#E64B35FF", HUB062 = "#91D1C2FF", HUB015 = '#FADA5E', HUB106 = "#3C5488FF", HUB183 = "#F39B7FFF", HUB175 = "#00A087FF", HUB197 = 'grey')) + scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0,0.01,0)) + theme_cowplot() + ylab('Fold change (% apoptotic cells)') + xlab('') + guides(fill="none") + theme( aspect.ratio = 5 / 3, axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust=1)) 1.2.4 Recovery statistics after 10 Gy radiation ######## # Data # ######## df <- as.data.frame(read_excel("../cna_analysis/data/clinical_and_dr/ 10gy_recovery_data.xlsx")) ########### # Wrangle # ########### df_res <- subset(df, resistancy_group == 'Resistant') df_sens <- subset(df, resistancy_group == 'Sensitive') ############## # Statistics # ############## # Resistant mean_days_res <- mean(as.numeric(df_res$days_to_full_recovery), na.rm = T) mean_days_res ## [1] 30.66667 sd_days_res <- sd(as.numeric(df_res$days_to_full_recovery), na.rm = T) sd_days_res ## [1] 11.54701 # Sensitve mean_days_sens <- mean(as.numeric(df_sens$days_to_full_recovery), na.rm = T) mean_days_sens ## [1] 49 sd_days_sens <- sd(as.numeric(df_sens$days_to_full_recovery), na.rm = T) sd_days_sens ## [1] 23.64318
